profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-01 14:25:57 -0700.

did.abstract: Frank Buxton was an actor, director, writer, host, and producer for assorted motion pictures and television programs. The collection consists of materials created and collected by Buxton related to the various projects he worked on throughout his career. The materials date from 1931 to 2008.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frank Buxton papers (Collection 2380). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jasmine Larkin, with support from Alex Adame, 2020. Accession LSC-2022-003 processed by Jasmine Larkin, with support from Elizabeth Gost, 2022. The materials are arranged in the existing order in which they were received from the donor.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Frank Buxton (1930-2018) was an actor, director, writer, producer, and host for assorted motion pictures and television programs. During his career he worked on various productions including Discovery; The Odd Couple, Happy Days, Mork and Mindy, and Hot Dog.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials related to the career of film and television actor, producer, writer, host and director, Frank Buxton. The materials were created and collected by Buxton throughout his career, and offer insight into the workings of film and television productions. The collection mainly consists of original film and television scripts including Mork and Mindy, The Odd Couple, Happy Days, and Discovery. A small portion of the collection contains correspondence, notes, and assorted documents related to productions. The materials date from 1931 to 2008.
